Package game

Class Fireworks

java.lang.Object
game.Fireworks
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Fireworks
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Implements a "rewards" display consisting of fireworks streaking into the sky and exploding in star bursts.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Fireworks.AnimatedLine
    Draws an animated line segment that appears to move or to lengthen over time.
    class  Fireworks.StarBurst
    Represents a complete star burst explosion with sound.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Fireworks()
    Creates a fireworks display that can be placed in a frame or an option pane.
    Fireworks​(javax.swing.JPanel panel)
    Creates a fireworks display that is drawn on the provided panel.

    Starts the fireworks display.

    Gets the panel on which the fireworks display is drawn.

    Test and demonstration.
    void run()
    Launches the fireworks at random intervals uniformly distributed in [0 ..
    void setExplosions​(int explosions, int maxDelay)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Fireworks

      public Fireworks()
      Creates a fireworks display that can be placed in a frame or an option pane. The display is drawn on an internal panel that is retrieved by calling getPanel().

    • Fireworks

      public Fireworks​(javax.swing.JPanel panel)
      Creates a fireworks display that is drawn on the provided panel.
      Parameters:
      panel - The panel on which the fireworks display is drawn. Use this constructor to draw on an existing and visible panel.

  • Method Details

    • setSound

      public void setSound​(boolean sound)
      Configures the fireworks display to either play the sound of an exploding firework or not.
      Parameters:
      sound - Play an explosion sound clip if true or execute silently if false.

    • setExplosions

      public void setExplosions​(int explosions, int maxDelay)
      Configure the fireworks display by setting the number of and the maximum time between consecutive firework launches.
      Parameters:
      explosions - The number of fireworks launched; set to 0 for an unending display.
      maxDelay - The maximum time (in milliseconds) between setting off fireworks; the average time between launches is maxDelay / 2.

    • fire

      public void fire()
      Starts the fireworks display. This method starts a new thread, making it safe to call this method with the dispatch thread.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the fireworks display. Fireworks already fired are allowed to finish but no new fireworks are fired after this method is called.

    • run

      public void run()
      Launches the fireworks at random intervals uniformly distributed in [0 .. maxDelay-1].
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • getPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
      Gets the panel on which the fireworks display is drawn.
      Returns:
      the fireworks display, either the internal panel created or the external panel associated during construction.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Test and demonstration.
